A fact: checker has rated the claim as "false", indicating that it has been thoroughly examined and found to be inaccurate or misleading.
The claim is part of Meta: s third-party fact-checking program, which aims to prevent the spread of false information on social media platforms.
The content rated as: false" will be downgraded on Facebook and Instagram, reducing its visibility and reach to a wider audience.
Africa Check: an independent and non-partisan organization, assesses claims made in the public arena using journalistic skills, evidence from online tools, readers, public sources, and experts to determine the accuracy of the claim.
